articles.title: 'Cowards' - Vinicius speaks out as Benfica deny racism claims
articles.summary: The Champions League match between Real Madrid and Benfica was halted for 10 minutes, with both sets of players leaving the pitch.

articles.title: Is VAR any better in the rest of Europe's top leagues?
articles.summary: You do not need to look far to find people proclaiming that VAR works fine outside the Premier League. BBC Sport spoke to people across Europe's top leagues to find out.

articles.title: Can you name every team that's finished top or bottom in the Premier League era?
articles.summary: We want you to name every team who has finished top or bottom in the Premier League era. Good luck!

articles.title: Pacquiao resumes return with 10-round exhibition against Provodnikov
articles.summary: Manny Pacquiao has confirmed he will take on Ruslan Provodnikov in a 10-round welterweight exhibition match on April 18 at Thomas and Mack Center in Las Vegas.

articles.title: 'I try to be balanced' - Mourinho after Vinicius alleges racist abuse
articles.summary: Benfica boss Jose Mourinho says he tried to be 'balanced' in his response to Vinicius Jr's racism allegation during the Champions League game against Real Madrid.

articles.title: Real Madrid tie at Benfica halted over Vinicius racism allegation
articles.summary: Real Madrid's Champions League knockout phase play-off tie at Benfica is halted for 10 minutes after Vinicius Junior reports alleged racist abuse.

articles.title: Arsenal make Saka best-paid player with new five-year deal
articles.summary: England winger Bukayo Saka commits his future to Premier League leaders Arsenal by signing a new five-year deal.

articles.title: Watch: Dundee United edge out Spartans in Scottish Cup
articles.summary: Watch as Dundee United survive an early red card - and a late comeback from League 2 visitors Spartans - to win 2-1 and set up a Scottish Cup quarter-final away to Premiership rivals Falkirk.

articles.title: Bicycle kicks & set-piece magic - FA Cup fourth round best goals
articles.summary: Watch the best goals from across the FA Cup fourth-round weekend, including a stunning free kick from Mansfield's Louis Reed and a strike from outside the box by Newcastle's Sandro Tonali.

articles.title: Own goal helps Brentford end Macclesfield's FA Cup run
articles.summary: Macclesfield's FA Cup dream ends in cruel fashion as Brentford win 1-0 after an own goal by Sam Heathcote.

articles.title: Arteta 'respectful' of fans but has felt 'exposed'
articles.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says he is "happy" to interact with fans but there are times where he has felt "exposed" and "not very comfortable".

articles.title: 'We really messed up' - does European football need more balance?
articles.summary: One set of clubs dominate the Champions League, another win their domestic title every year but cannot compete - does European football have a problem?

articles.title: Toney leaves Premier League door open - Wednesday's gossip
articles.summary: Ivan Toney leaves the door open for a move back to the Premier League, Liverpool have no plans to sell Dominik Szoboszlai, Nick Woltemade is eyeing a move back to the Bundesliga, plus more.

articles.title: 'Some people think it's live' - how is the commentary in EA Sports FC 26 put together?
articles.summary: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains how the commentary in best-selling football video game EA FC 26 is put together.

articles.title: Tudor says 'no time for excuses' about Spurs form
articles.summary: New Tottenham Hotspur interim manager Igor Tudor says "nobody can accept" the club's current position.

highlights.title: Premier League highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: What did we learn from the biggest Championship game of the season?
articles.summary: After Coventry's win over Middlesbrough took them top of the Championship, where do both sides go from here?

articles.title: 'Oh wow, TWO!?' | Nijman has back-to-back bounce-outs in Players Championship
articles.summary: Wessel Nijman had a moment to forget as he had back-to-back bounce-outs in one visit as he lost to Dutch compatriot Kevin Doets in the Players Championship 3. Credit: OfficialPDC

articles.title: Leeds beat Birmingham on penalties in FA Cup
articles.summary: Watch highlights as Leeds United hold their nerve to beat Championship oppponents Birmingham City 4-2 on penalties and reach the FA Cup fifth round.

articles.title: Did the water bottle help or hinder Leeds keeper Perri?
articles.summary: BBC Sport pundit Paul Robinson discusses Leeds United goalkeeper Lucas Perri's penalty shootout notes on his water bottle after the FA Cup win over Birmingham.

articles.title: Sunderland beat spirited Oxford in FA Cup
articles.summary: Watch highlights as Sunderland edge past Championship strugglers Oxford United to move into the FA Cup fifth round.

articles.title: O'Neill 'delighted' Northern Ireland play-off is in Bergamo
articles.summary: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill says he is "delighted" that March's World Cup play-off semi-final with Italy will be played in Bergamo.

articles.title: Scotland choose Charlotte as base for World Cup
articles.summary: Scotland will set up camp at the home of Charlotte FC in North Carolina for the duration of the World Cup.
